{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3597594,"name":"Oded Benjamini ","username":"Feenchboi15","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/3ec8ea/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T13:34:10.972Z","cooked":"

Hey there,
we want to revive some of our older bots but we don’t have the needed amount of rios to do so.
I was wondering if it is possible to run a full bot with a controller like Arduino or procceseor like Raspberry Pi? How would communications with PDP would work? if it is not possible to use PDP with this configuration, what alternative would you recommend?

for context, the bot have 7 cim motors and some encoders, nothing more.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T13:34:10.972Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":93.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499893,"topic_slug":"arduino-for-demo-bot","display_username":"Oded Benjamini ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62572,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3597598,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T13:38:53.108Z","cooked":"

I’d target an ESP32 rather than the AVR Arduinos (faster and built-in wireless comms).

Then look into suitable PWM motor controllers (same as what you used already probably) and drive them with PWM signals instead of CAN.

With next year being the last year for the Rio, I don’t blame you for not wanting to buy a new one, but that might also open up the chance to buy one second-hand.

Do you really need PDP communication? That’s probably more work than it’s worth.

All it gives you is current monitoring, and you probably don’t need that on all the channels. It might be best to just put current sensors where they’re needed.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T16:07:53.531Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499893,"topic_slug":"arduino-for-demo-bot","display_username":"Pedro Braga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3597871,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T18:54:25.402Z","cooked":"

You can use a raspberry pi or Jetson nano with CTRE Can 2.0 devices. Talon SRX, Victor SPX, Pigeon 1.0, Original PDP and the Gadgeteer based sensors will work with a Canable or even a Hero Board with custom firmware as the adapter.

v5.docs.ctr-electronics.com

Prepare Linux Robot Controller

Why prepare Linux Robot Controller?: Preparing a Linux robot controller allows CAN Device control without a roboRIO for non-FRC use or as a secondary processor that can also directly control CAN De...

This would give you direct API access to the CTRE libraries for v5.

My main concern with the PDP was actually supplying voltage to all of the components. Is there another, easier way to do this without a PDP?

They didn’t say not to use a PDP, but rather to not use PDP communications.

(Take a PDP sitting on your workbench unpowered and measure continuity between the input and the outputs.)

One thing to keep in mind is that WPILib running on the Rio has a number of robust safety features that you would have to replicate if you use a different controller.

In particular, when the Rio loses network communications with the drive station, all motor outputs get immediately disabled. This is very important, because you do not want 150 pounds of uncontrolled robot careening around your shop, or worse yet at a public outreach event where spectators could be injured.

A safer way to proceed might be to procure an older Rio 1.0 to use as the controller.
